learning_objective: Model how computer hardware and software work together as a system to accomplish tasks.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Jordan is developing an LGBTQ+ social app. They want to ensure that users will have a smooth and hassle-free experience. To achieve this, they're tasked with writing an efficient computer algorithm to support the seamless flow of data transmission and handling between the software and hardware aspects of the system. A snippet of their code as follows:Which of the following best explains what this code snippet does?",
    "Answer1": "The code creates a flag to ensure proper data update on the platform.",
    "Answer2": "The code generates a random user to test the functionality of the app.",
    "Answer3": "The code checks for the system’s software compatibility with users' data.",
    "Answer4": "The code initializes the system's hardware before any action is performed on the app.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "The code snippet initializes a flag (initially set to false). Whenever a user updates their data, the flag is set to true, indicating a need for data transmission/renewal between the hardware and software parts of the system - an efficient way of ensuring smooth and real-time updates within the app.",
    "code_snippet": "boolean dataUpdated = false
action userDataUpdate()
    dataUpdated = true
end
class User
    integer userId
    text userName
    text preferredPronoun
end
action updateUserData(User user)
    userId = user.userId
    userName = user.userName
    preferredPronoun = user.preferredPronoun
    userDataUpdate()
end"
}
